issues.title: Try leaving a comment on this issue.
issues.description:
Adding comments to an issue is a useful way to record additional detail about an issue, and collaborate with team members. Comments are shown in the Comments section when you view an issue.


  1. Open the issue on which to add your comment.
  2. Click the Add a comment button.
  3. In the Comment text box, type your comment
  4. Click the Save button or the Enter key to save the comment.

issues.title: Preparing the backend API
issues.description:
I will set up a GraphQL endpoint as soon as possible

I am currently using a json file for storing data. I like the idea behind GraphQL, it is the good chance to learn more about that technology.

issues.title: Set up Akita state management
issues.description:
I heard about Akita and would love to try this

Akita is a state management pattern, built on top of RxJS, which takes the idea of multiple data stores from Flux and the immutable updates from Redux, along with the concept of streaming data, to create the Observable Data Stores model.

issues.title: What is Angular Jira clone application
issues.description:
What is this and who is it for?

I do Angular development and this is a showcase product I've built in my spare time. It's a very good example of modern, real-world Angular codebase.

  • Proven, scalable, and easy to understand project structure
  • All code are written in TypeScript
  • Project setup with Angular CLI
  • Use Akita state management
  • Use TailwindCSS

issues.title: Angular router not working on Netlify on refresh
issues.description:
Old question, but for those who might stumble on it on how to enable angular routing in Netlify. Create a file _redirects in your src folder, add the following to it:
